intro: Sisymbrium andinum var. hossei, commonly known as the Andean mustard, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and potential ecological importance in its native habitat.
